# Architecture Research

Yes, this is a **strong, cost-effective, and scalable serverless stack for a monitoring SaaS**, leveraging specialized tools (Turso for distributed SQL, S3 for static hosting) with powerful AWS services (Lambda for API/processing, EventBridge for scheduling), ideal for event-driven, auto-scaling workloads common in monitoring, though you must manage potential [Lambda cold starts](https://www.google.com/search?q=Lambda+cold+starts&num=10&sca_esv=89aaa52b873f06b6&sxsrf=ANbL-n5SWXHNjAf5YWgqT6cy7AVltVWbJQ%3A1770321431450&ei=F_aEabLRGvri5NoP-Z-ZUA&biw=1870&bih=927&ved=2ahUKEwihqobYkcOSAxVXL1kFHXQmFMQQgK4QegQIARAB&uact=5&oq=is+using+turso+for+db%2C+aws+lambda+for+go+api%2C+Amazon+EventBridge+Rules+for+cron+jobs%2C+and+aws+s3+for+vue+spa+and+marketing+site+a+good+choic+for+a+server+monitoring+saas%3F&gs_&sclient=gws-wiz-serp) and ensure Turso fits your data needs (e.g., time-series).

**Strengths of this Architecture:**

- **Cost-Effective & Scalable:** Serverless components (Lambda, Netlify, EventBridge) scale automatically and you pay for usage, ideal for variable monitoring loads.
- **High Performance (with care):** Turso provides low-latency, distributed SQL, while Lambda's speed for short tasks fits well.
- **Event-Driven:** The stack naturally supports event-driven monitoring (e.g., data ingestion, alerts via EventBridge).
- **Simplified Operations:** Managed services reduce infrastructure overhead, letting you focus on monitoring features.

**Component Breakdown:**

- [**Turso (Database)](https://www.google.com/search?q=Turso+%28Database%29&num=10&sca_esv=89aaa52b873f06b6&sxsrf=ANbL-n5SWXHNjAf5YWgqT6cy7AVltVWbJQ%3A1770321431450&ei=F_aEabLRGvri5NoP-Z-ZUA&biw=1870&bih=927&ved=2ahUKEwihqobYkcOSAxVXL1kFHXQmFMQQgK4QegQIBRAB&uact=5&oq=is+using+turso+for+db%2C+aws+lambda+for+go+api%2C+Amazon+EventBridge+Rules+for+cron+jobs%2C+and+aws+s3+for+vue+spa+and+marketing+site+a+good+choic+for+a+server+monitoring+saas%3F&gs_&sclient=gws-wiz-serp&mstk=AUtExfDqAcb-fohtueeSinMGHX256aI4a6B93TYkBPUUaGPEmMuv46deboah1Xe1hXavlJesF1r2ESMSbDSsjqwHaJlPIeChGnIU1ZnmFroRXiz4RUcrJFy14j6U8Yy8keViKLm1ucXTa6NdE6kZSDejXEKE2-3xybIOhJ3cSgBlqHdYcxQQ6wUejM7wGK_sIy4QMNXi4PKEA8xQvXDqVgzsJBqHSlu_g62SvOTpzqiGcnf7Jr3LgZOD2D9fWopaJQpCAHix52UMv04jhzf6t9x2tkxO&csui=3):** Excellent for distributed, globally replicated data, potentially great for time-series monitoring data with its SQLite core and replication.
- [**AWS Lambda (Go API)](https://www.google.com/search?q=AWS+Lambda+%28Go+API%29&num=10&sca_esv=89aaa52b873f06b6&sxsrf=ANbL-n5SWXHNjAf5YWgqT6cy7AVltVWbJQ%3A1770321431450&ei=F_aEabLRGvri5NoP-Z-ZUA&biw=1870&bih=927&ved=2ahUKEwihqobYkcOSAxVXL1kFHXQmFMQQgK4QegQIBRAD&uact=5&oq=is+using+turso+for+db%2C+aws+lambda+for+go+api%2C+Amazon+EventBridge+Rules+for+cron+jobs%2C+and+aws+s3+for+vue+spa+and+marketing+site+a+good+choic+for+a+server+monitoring+saas%3F&gs_&sclient=gws-wiz-serp&mstk=AUtExfDqAcb-fohtueeSinMGHX256aI4a6B93TYkBPUUaGPEmMuv46deboah1Xe1hXavlJesF1r2ESMSbDSsjqwHaJlPIeChGnIU1ZnmFroRXiz4RUcrJFy14j6U8Yy8keViKLm1ucXTa6NdE6kZSDejXEKE2-3xybIOhJ3cSgBlqHdYcxQQ6wUejM7wGK_sIy4QMNXi4PKEA8xQvXDqVgzsJBqHSlu_g62SvOTpzqiGcnf7Jr3LgZOD2D9fWopaJQpCAHix52UMv04jhzf6t9x2tkxO&csui=3):** Perfect for stateless API endpoints, data processing, and responding to events, with Go offering excellent performance.
- [**Amazon EventBridge Rules (Cron)](https://www.google.com/search?q=Amazon+EventBridge+Rules+%28Cron%29&num=10&sca_esv=89aaa52b873f06b6&sxsrf=ANbL-n5SWXHNjAf5YWgqT6cy7AVltVWbJQ%3A1770321431450&ei=F_aEabLRGvri5NoP-Z-ZUA&biw=1870&bih=927&ved=2ahUKEwihqobYkcOSAxVXL1kFHXQmFMQQgK4QegQIBRAF&uact=5&oq=is+using+turso+for+db%2C+aws+lambda+for+go+api%2C+Amazon+EventBridge+Rules+for+cron+jobs%2C+and+aws+s3+for+vue+spa+and+marketing+site+a+good+choic+for+a+server+monitoring+saas%3F&gs_&sclient=gws-wiz-serp&mstk=AUtExfDqAcb-fohtueeSinMGHX256aI4a6B93TYkBPUUaGPEmMuv46deboah1Xe1hXavlJesF1r2ESMSbDSsjqwHaJlPIeChGnIU1ZnmFroRXiz4RUcrJFy14j6U8Yy8keViKLm1ucXTa6NdE6kZSDejXEKE2-3xybIOhJ3cSgBlqHdYcxQQ6wUejM7wGK_sIy4QMNXi4PKEA8xQvXDqVgzsJBqHSlu_g62SvOTpzqiGcnf7Jr3LgZOD2D9fWopaJQpCAHix52UMv04jhzf6t9x2tkxO&csui=3):** The standard AWS way to schedule tasks (e.g., health checks, data aggregation) that trigger Lambda functions.
- [**AWS S3 (Vue SPA/Site)](https://www.google.com/search?q=AWS+S3+%28Vue+SPA%2FSite%29&num=10&sca_esv=89aaa52b873f06b6&sxsrf=ANbL-n5SWXHNjAf5YWgqT6cy7AVltVWbJQ%3A1770321431450&ei=F_aEabLRGvri5NoP-Z-ZUA&biw=1870&bih=927&ved=2ahUKEwihqobYkcOSAxVXL1kFHXQmFMQQgK4QegQIBRAH&uact=5&oq=is+using+turso+for+db%2C+aws+lambda+for+go+api%2C+Amazon+EventBridge+Rules+for+cron+jobs%2C+and+aws+s3+for+vue+spa+and+marketing+site+a+good+choic+for+a+server+monitoring+saas%3F&gs_&sclient=gws-wiz-serp&mstk=AUtExfDqAcb-fohtueeSinMGHX256aI4a6B93TYkBPUUaGPEmMuv46deboah1Xe1hXavlJesF1r2ESMSbDSsjqwHaJlPIeChGnIU1ZnmFroRXiz4RUcrJFy14j6U8Yy8keViKLm1ucXTa6NdE6kZSDejXEKE2-3xybIOhJ3cSgBlqHdYcxQQ6wUejM7wGK_sIy4QMNXi4PKEA8xQvXDqVgzsJBqHSlu_g62SvOTpzqiGcnf7Jr3LgZOD2D9fWopaJQpCAHix52UMv04jhzf6t9x2tkxO&csui=3):** The best, most cost-effective way to host static sites and SPAs, with easy integration into AWS CDNs (CloudFront).
- Astro for marketing website

**Considerations:**

- [**Cold Starts](https://www.google.com/search?q=Cold+Starts&num=10&sca_esv=89aaa52b873f06b6&sxsrf=ANbL-n5SWXHNjAf5YWgqT6cy7AVltVWbJQ%3A1770321431450&ei=F_aEabLRGvri5NoP-Z-ZUA&biw=1870&bih=927&ved=2ahUKEwihqobYkcOSAxVXL1kFHXQmFMQQgK4QegQIBxAB&uact=5&oq=is+using+turso+for+db%2C+aws+lambda+for+go+api%2C+Amazon+EventBridge+Rules+for+cron+jobs%2C+and+aws+s3+for+vue+spa+and+marketing+site+a+good+choic+for+a+server+monitoring+saas%3F&gs_&sclient=gws-wiz-serp&mstk=AUtExfDqAcb-fohtueeSinMGHX256aI4a6B93TYkBPUUaGPEmMuv46deboah1Xe1hXavlJesF1r2ESMSbDSsjqwHaJlPIeChGnIU1ZnmFroRXiz4RUcrJFy14j6U8Yy8keViKLm1ucXTa6NdE6kZSDejXEKE2-3xybIOhJ3cSgBlqHdYcxQQ6wUejM7wGK_sIy4QMNXi4PKEA8xQvXDqVgzsJBqHSlu_g62SvOTpzqiGcnf7Jr3LgZOD2D9fWopaJQpCAHix52UMv04jhzf6t9x2tkxO&csui=3):** Lambda cold starts can add latency; consider provisioned concurrency or optimizing function size if real-time API responses are critical.
- **Turso Data Model:** Ensure Turso's distributed SQLite structure suits your monitoring data (metrics, logs, events) and query patterns.
- **Monitoring Data Volume:** For *very* high-volume, pure time-series data, dedicated time-series databases (like [Amazon Timestream](https://www.google.com/search?q=Amazon+Timestream&num=10&sca_esv=89aaa52b873f06b6&sxsrf=ANbL-n5SWXHNjAf5YWgqT6cy7AVltVWbJQ%3A1770321431450&ei=F_aEabLRGvri5NoP-Z-ZUA&biw=1870&bih=927&ved=2ahUKEwihqobYkcOSAxVXL1kFHXQmFMQQgK4QegQIBxAE&uact=5&oq=is+using+turso+for+db%2C+aws+lambda+for+go+api%2C+Amazon+EventBridge+Rules+for+cron+jobs%2C+and+aws+s3+for+vue+spa+and+marketing+site+a+good+choic+for+a+server+monitoring+saas%3F&gs_&sclient=gws-wiz-serp&mstk=AUtExfDqAcb-fohtueeSinMGHX256aI4a6B93TYkBPUUaGPEmMuv46deboah1Xe1hXavlJesF1r2ESMSbDSsjqwHaJlPIeChGnIU1ZnmFroRXiz4RUcrJFy14j6U8Yy8keViKLm1ucXTa6NdE6kZSDejXEKE2-3xybIOhJ3cSgBlqHdYcxQQ6wUejM7wGK_sIy4QMNXi4PKEA8xQvXDqVgzsJBqHSlu_g62SvOTpzqiGcnf7Jr3LgZOD2D9fWopaJQpCAHix52UMv04jhzf6t9x2tkxO&csui=3)) might eventually be more specialized, but Turso is a strong start.

**Overall:** This is a modern, well-suited stack for building a robust, scalable server monitoring SaaS efficiently.
